t: Job 36
Then*p Elihu continued, saying:
Be*pn patient with me a little longer, and I will inform you, for*ln there is still more to be said on God’s behalf.
I*ln will get my knowledge from a distant place and*ln ascribe justice to my Maker.
Indeed,*ln my words are not false; one*ln who has complete knowledge is with you.
Yes,*pn God is mighty, but he despises no one; he*ln understands all things.
He*ln does not keep the wicked alive, but*ln he gives justice to the oppressed.
He*ln does not withdraw his gaze from the righteous, but*ln he seats them forever with enthroned kings, and*ln they are exalted.
If*pn people are bound with chains and*ln trapped by the cords of affliction,
God*ln tells them what they have done and*ln how arrogantly they have transgressed.
He*ln opens their ears to correction and*ln tells them to repent from iniquity.
If*ln they listen and serve him, they*ln will end their days in prosperity and*ln their years in happiness.
But*ln if they do not listen, they*ln will cross the river of death and*ln die without knowledge.
Those*pn who have a godless heart harbor anger; even*ln when God binds them, they do not cry for help.
They*ln die in their youth; their*ln life ends among male cult prostitutes.
God*ln rescues the afflicted by their affliction; he*ln instructs them by their torment.
Indeed,*pn he lured you from the jaws of distress to*ln a spacious and unconfined place. Your*ln table was spread with choice food.
Yet*ln now you are obsessed with the judgment due the wicked; judgment*ln and justice have seized you.
Be*ln careful that no one lures you with riches; do*ln not let a large ransom lead you astray.
Can*ln your wealth or all your physical exertion keep*ln you from distress?
Do*ln not long for the night when*ln nations will disappear from their places.
Be*ln careful that you do not turn to iniquity, for*ln that is why you have been tested by affliction.
Look,*pn God shows himself exalted by his power. Who*ln is a teacher like him?
Who*ln has appointed his way for him, and*ln who has declared, “You have done wrong”?
Remember*ln that you should praise his work, which*ln people have sung about.
All*ln mankind has seen it; people*ln have looked at it from a distance.
Yes,*ln God is exalted beyond our knowledge; the*ln number of his years cannot be counted.
For*ln he makes waterdrops evaporate; they*ln distill the rain into its mist,
which*ln the clouds pour out and*ln shower abundantly on mankind.
Can*ln anyone understand how the clouds spread out or*ln how the thunder roars from God’s pavilion?
See*ln how he spreads his lightning around him and*ln covers the depths of the sea.
For*ln he judges the nations with these; he*ln gives food in abundance.
He*ln covers his hands with lightning and*ln commands it to hit its mark.
The*ln thunder declares his presence; the*ln cattle also, the approaching storm.
